title: Kamerel
data:
[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**Kamerel** are a category of [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") added in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"). They are represented by ".

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Amm Kamerel](#Amm_Kamerel)

  - [1.1 Equipment sets](#Equipment_sets)

    - [1.1.1 Warrior](#Warrior)
    - [1.1.2 Fighter driver](#Fighter_driver)
    - [1.1.3 Wizard driver](#Wizard_driver)
    - [1.1.4 Wizard leader](#Wizard_leader)

- [2 Hudor Kamerel](#Hudor_Kamerel)

- [3 Sharab Kamerel](#Sharab_Kamerel)

- [4 Ara Kamerel](#Ara_Kamerel)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

| An Amm Kamerel:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                                                                                   |

### Equipment sets

#### Warrior

81 out of 100 will be **warriors**:

- Don't cast spells (are spawned [canceled](/wiki/Canceled "Canceled"))
- [Mirrorblade](/wiki/Mirrorblade "Mirrorblade")
- [Roundshield](/wiki/Roundshield "Roundshield") (Bronze, silver, or glass)
- [Banded mail](/wiki/Banded_mail "Banded mail") (Bronze, silver, or glass)

#### Fighter driver

9 out of 100 will be **fighter drivers**:

- +3 levels
- Intrinsic fast speed
- Don't cast spells (are spawned [canceled](/wiki/Canceled "Canceled"))
- +1 [Mirrorblade](/wiki/Mirrorblade "Mirrorblade")
- +1 [Roundshield](/wiki/Roundshield "Roundshield") (Bronze, silver, or glass)
- +1 [Plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail") (Bronze, silver, or glass)

#### Wizard driver

9 out of 100 will be **wizard drivers**:

- +3 levels
- Mirror (which, in kamerel hands, removes the Outland's spell failure chance)
- Cast [open wounds](/wiki/Open_wounds "Open wounds")
- [Elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak"), [Dwarvish cloak](/wiki/Dwarvish_cloak "Dwarvish cloak"), or [Cloak of invisibility](/wiki/Cloak_of_invisibility "Cloak of invisibility")
- +1 [Stiletto](/wiki/Stiletto "Stiletto") (Bronze, silver, or glass)

#### Wizard leader

1 out of 100 will be **wizard leaders**:

- +7 levels
- Cast [open wounds](/wiki/Open_wounds "Open wounds")
- Mirror (which, in kamerel hands, removes the Outland's spell failure chance)
- [Cloak of protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection")
- +1 [Stiletto](/wiki/Stiletto "Stiletto") (Bronze, silver, or glass)

| A Hudor Kamerel:* can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim").
* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming").
* [does not move](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile"). |                                                                                                                                                                          |

**Hudor Kamerel** can't move, and are invisible while over water or shallow water. They are generated with [Mirrors](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") that enable them to bypass the Outland's spell failure chance. They cast the [open wounds](/wiki/Open_wounds "Open wounds") monster spell.

| A Sharab Kamerel:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                                                                                   |

**Sharab Kamerel** are generated with [Mirrors](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") that enable them to bypass the Outland's spell failure chance. They cast the [psi bolt](/wiki/Psi_bolt "Psi bolt") monster spell.

Sharab Kamerel have monster displacement (which causes 50% of all melee attacks to miss them) and are resistant to most physical attacks (in the same way that [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade") resist most attacks). Unlike shades, Sharab Kamerel are not vulnerable to silver, but they *are* vulnerable to both blessed and cursed items.

| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"), [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold"), [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep"), [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock"), [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison")                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| An Ara Kamerel:* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor").
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead"), the [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation"), and your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic.
* does not naturally [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") HP. |                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

**Ara Kamerel** are generated with [Mirrors](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") that enable them to bypass the Outland's spell failure chance. They cast the [open wounds](/wiki/Open_wounds "Open wounds") monster spell.

In addition, they are generated with a [Kamerel Vajra](/wiki/Kamerel_Vajra "Kamerel Vajra"), a special type of [lightsaber](/wiki/Lightsaber "Lightsaber"). In the hands of an Ara Kamerel, a Vajra is a 3x lightsaber weapon that does an additional 6d6 lightning damage and blinds the target.

Ara Kamerel have transcended the regular universe, and are now present only as reflections of their higher selves. If an Ara Kamerel is destroyed, it is able to convert any [gold golem](/wiki/Gold_golem "Gold golem") on the level into a new version of itself, albeit without its special equipment. Hostile and peaceful Ara Kamerel are anchored to the current dungeon level and don't move between levels while unincarnate. Tame Ara Kamerel are anchored to the player character and will follow them between dungeon levels, and will reincarnate into any gold golem the player comes across.

## Encyclopedia entry

You live in the mirror as well as the real world - the  
proof's right there when you gaze at the reflection.  
But, does something live only in that mirror place?  
Stare into the mirror my friend. Does something  
besides you look back?  
\[ Tales from the Infinite Staircase, by Monte Cook]
html:
Kamerel

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Kamerel are a category of monsters added in dNetHack. They are represented by ".

Amm Kamerel

" Amm Kamerel (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks Weapon 1d1 physical, Magic 0d6 clerical spell
" Amm Kamerel (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Weapon 1d1 physical, Magic 0d6 clerical spell

Base level 3
Base experience 43
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 140
Nutritional value 0
Size small
Resistances shock, petrification
Resistances conveyed fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison

An Amm Kamerel:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.

Equipment sets

Warrior

81 out of 100 will be warriors:

  • Don't cast spells (are spawned canceled)
  • Mirrorblade
  • Roundshield (Bronze, silver, or glass)
  • Banded mail (Bronze, silver, or glass)

Fighter driver

9 out of 100 will be fighter drivers:

  • +3 levels
  • Intrinsic fast speed
  • Don't cast spells (are spawned canceled)
  • +1 Mirrorblade
  • +1 Roundshield (Bronze, silver, or glass)
  • +1 Plate mail (Bronze, silver, or glass)

Wizard driver

9 out of 100 will be wizard drivers:

  • +3 levels
  • Mirror (which, in kamerel hands, removes the Outland's spell failure chance)
  • Cast open wounds
  • Elven cloak, Dwarvish cloak, or Cloak of invisibility
  • +1 Stiletto (Bronze, silver, or glass)

Wizard leader

1 out of 100 will be wizard leaders:

  • +7 levels
  • Cast open wounds
  • Mirror (which, in kamerel hands, removes the Outland's spell failure chance)
  • Cloak of protection
  • +1 Stiletto (Bronze, silver, or glass)

Hudor Kamerel

Difficulty 10

Resistances conveyed fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison

A Hudor Kamerel:

  • can swim.
  • can survive underwater.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.
  • does not move.

Hudor Kamerel can't move, and are invisible while over water or shallow water. They are generated with Mirrors that enable them to bypass the Outland's spell failure chance. They cast the open wounds monster spell.

Sharab Kamerel

" Sharab Kamerel (No tile)
Difficulty 14

" Sharab Kamerel (No tile)
Difficulty 14

Claw 8d1 physical, Claw 8d1 physical, Claw 8d1 physical, Magic 2d6 clerical spell

Base level 10
Base experience 231
Speed 18
Base AC 0
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 750
Nutritional value 0
Size medium
Resistances shock, petrification
Resistances conveyed fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison

A Sharab Kamerel:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.

Sharab Kamerel are generated with Mirrors that enable them to bypass the Outland's spell failure chance. They cast the psi bolt monster spell.

Sharab Kamerel have monster displacement (which causes 50% of all melee attacks to miss them) and are resistant to most physical attacks (in the same way that shades resist most attacks). Unlike shades, Sharab Kamerel are not vulnerable to silver, but they are vulnerable to both blessed and cursed items.

Ara Kamerel

" Ara Kamerel (No tile)
Difficulty 19
Attacks Weapon 2d8 physical, Claw 2d3 Amulet theft, Cast 0d0 clerical spell
" Ara Kamerel (No tile)
Difficulty 19
Attacks

Weapon 2d8 physical, Claw 2d3 Amulet theft, Cast 0d0 clerical spell

Base level 15
Base experience 381
Speed 9
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 4500
Nutritional value 0
Size large
Resistances sleep, shock, poison, acid, petrification, magic
Resistances conveyed fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison

An Ara Kamerel:

  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • has a thick hide.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor, the Bell of Opening, the Book of the Dead, the Candelabrum of Invocation, and your quest artifact.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.

Ara Kamerel are generated with Mirrors that enable them to bypass the Outland's spell failure chance. They cast the open wounds monster spell.

In addition, they are generated with a Kamerel Vajra, a special type of lightsaber. In the hands of an Ara Kamerel, a Vajra is a 3x lightsaber weapon that does an additional 6d6 lightning damage and blinds the target.

Ara Kamerel have transcended the regular universe, and are now present only as reflections of their higher selves. If an Ara Kamerel is destroyed, it is able to convert any gold golem on the level into a new version of itself, albeit without its special equipment. Hostile and peaceful Ara Kamerel are anchored to the current dungeon level and don't move between levels while unincarnate. Tame Ara Kamerel are anchored to the player character and will follow them between dungeon levels, and will reincarnate into any gold golem the player comes across.

Encyclopedia entry

You live in the mirror as well as the real world - the
proof's right there when you gaze at the reflection.
But, does something live only in that mirror place?
Stare into the mirror my friend. Does something
besides you look back?
[ Tales from the Infinite Staircase, by Monte Cook]
